thread.title: Chamber Chatter: Halloween Bash this Saturday
thread.title_full: Chamber Chatter: Halloween Bash this Saturday | www.statesman.com

author: Kathy Lynch
title: Chamber Chatter: Halloween Bash this Saturday
text:
The Smithville Recreation Center will host their annual Halloween Bash on Saturday Oct. 24 from 4-8 p.m. Young and old are invited to come and enjoy this fun event. There will be games, candy, prizes and a costume contest around 6 p.m. Volunteers who can help run a game booth are needed. Call the recreation center at 512-237-3282 ext. 7 to volunteer.
Culture of Health for Smithville Presentation
There will be a free dinner and a presentation on the Culture of Health for Smithville on Monday, Oct. 26 from 6-7:30 p.m. at the Smithville Recreation Center, 106 Royston St. This presentation is brought to Smithville by the city, school, library, Wesley Nurse and others. Mary Bennet from the University of Wisconsin and the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation will also be one of the presenters. The presentation will bring information, seek information and involve the community in the Culture of Health for Smithville. For questions call Sharlene Scheler RN, Wesley Nurse at 210-259-3733.
Love Your Pets – Spay and Neuter Them
The Emancipet Mobile clinic will be at the Smithville Recreation Center, 106 Royston St. on Monday, Oct. 26. Bring in your pets for low-cost spay and neuter services. Appointments are required for the spay and neuter procedures. Call 512-587-7729 or visit www.emancipet.org/mobile to make an appointment. Other vaccinations, preventative medicine and microchips will be available as well.
Spoken Word
Spoken Word will meet on Tuesday, Oct. 27 at 7 p.m. at 301 Burleson St. Please bring your beverage of choice and a small snack for the communal table.
Airing of the Quilts
Enjoy our wonderful fall weather as you stroll Smithville’s Main Street and surrounding streets to see an awesome display of quilts during the annual Airing of the Quilts on Saturday Nov.14. Some of the quilts on display will be for sale. There will also be a quilt raffle. This is a free event. Sponsorship opportunities are available for this event at $500, $250 and $100. Contact the chamber at 512-237-2313 with any questions.
Tour of Homes
The Smithville Tour of Homes will be held on Saturday, Nov. 14 from 12-4 p.m. Cost is $10 per person. Visit some of Smithville’s most historic homes and churches. Tickets will be available at the Chamber office, 100 NW 1st St., First National Bank, 312 Main St. and Prosperity Bank, 406 Main St.
Gingerbread Friend Adoptions Now Open
Each year in conjunction with the Festival of Lights celebration the Chamber offers Gingerbread Friend Adoptions. Many visitors and locals find the addition of these “friends” to our town festive and charming. Each year more and more come out to play. If you have never adopted a friend make this year your first!
There are many advantages to adopting a Gingerbread Friend. There are no late night feeding or looking for that lost pacifier; no diapers to change or burp up all over your clothes.
Visit www.smithvilletx.org to fill out an adoption form and mail to us with your $50 adoption fee to P.O. Box 716, Smithville, TX 78957 or drop off at the Chamber office; stop by the Chamber office at 100 NW 1st St. to fill out an adoption form; or email kathy.lynch@smithvilletx.org. Deadline to adopt is Friday, November 6.
DOWN THE ROAD
The Friends of the Smithville Public Library will host their annual bake sale on Friday, Oct. 30 in front of First National Bank; 312 Main St. The bake sale will start at 9 a.m. and quickly sells out. Get there early for a choice of delicious baked goods.
The annual Fall Book Sale at the Smithville Public Library will be held Thursday through Saturday, Oct. 29, 30 and 31. Hours of operation are 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. on Thursday; 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Friday; and 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Saturday. Come browse the huge variety of books at super cheap prices. The library is located at 507 Main St.
The Smithville Rebekah Lodge #180 & the Odd Fellow Lodge #393, 406 Turney St., will have their annual turkey dinner on Sunday, Nov. 8, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. The meal will consist of turkey, dressing and all the sides, plus a drink and dessert. Cost is $8 for adults and $5 for children 10 and under. Eat in or get it to go. A portion of the proceeds will go towards scholarships for Smithville & Bastrop student seniors.
The Chamber office will be closed on Wednesday, Nov. 11 in observance of Veterans Day.
The First United Methodist Church will host a Quilt Fest on Friday, Nov. 13 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Saturday, Nov. 14 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. There will be the quilt show, vendors, and Café “Piece & Plenty”. The event will be at 400 Olive St., Smithville.
The Smithville Genealogy Society will hold a meeting on Saturday, Nov. 14 at 9:30 a.m. at the Smithville Public Library, 507 Main St. No reservations, fees or membership requirements apply. Meetings are the second Saturday each month except August and December. For more information, call Carol Snyder at 830-839-4080 or Smithville Public Library at 512-237-3282, Ext. 6.
The Smithville Chamber of Commerce and First National Bank invite you to kick off the Smithville Holiday Season during the Chamber mixer to be held on Thursday, Nov. 19, from 5-7 p.m. at 312 Main St. Bring a new unwrapped toy to help our Smithville Police Association fill a police car with toys for their wonderful Blue Santa gift program. Toys for all ages are needed. Cash donations also help fill the stockings of those children in Smithville whose holiday season is not so bright. Donations can be made at any time at the Smithville Police Station.
Mosaic Art & Home will host a reception on Friday, Nov. 20 from 7-9 p.m. for Wanda Gamble featuring new works. Mosaic is located at 218 Main St.
Men Living for Christ will host a Feed the Community program on Saturday, Nov. 21 at the Smithville Recreation Center. The event will begin at 11:00 a.m. The cost of the meal is free. Join in for food and fellowship.
Smithville Trades Day will be held on Saturday, Nov. 21, from 10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. in the 100-200 blocks of Main Street, Smithville. Come browse to find a new treasure. To become a vendor contact John Powell at 210-627-4533 or email him at john.powell@smithvilletradesday.com.
Spoken Word will meet on Tuesday, Nov. 24 at 7 p.m. at 301 Burleson St. Please bring your beverage of choice and a small snack for the communal table.
The Chamber office will be closed Thursday and Friday, Nov. 26 and 27 for the Thanksgiving holidays.
